answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some areas that have taken on a policy of Tele- work/ Telecommuting. You can review their policies below and contact them directly for more information.
Loudoun County, VA:
http://icma.org/en/Article/11166/Loudoun_County_VA_Receives_National_Award_for_Telework_Program
City of Mercer Island, WA: http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/14663/The_Telecommuters_Guide
City of Las Vegas, NV:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/14664/Telecommuting_Policy
City of Madison, WI:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/6765/Madison_Administrative_Procedure_Telecommuting_Policy
City of Austin, Texas:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/2964/Telework_Program_Overview
I have also included some articles about tele-work and telecommuting which may be helpful.
This is a report by the US Department of Labor discussing tele-work as the way of the future.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/11448/Telework_and_the_New_Workplace_of_the_21st_Century
Below is an article by Austin Klein from Runzheimer International about telecommuting and how the work force is changing.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/2128/Virtual_Work__Preparing_for_the_Changing_Labor_Force
Finally, you can view a brief article about the environmental benefits of telecommuting  which includes contact information for more information.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/102326/Telecommuting_to_Fight_Pollution
I hope these offer you some help!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org
